page.title: 18A DAY IN MY BROTHER'S LIFE
page.content: I woke up and went into my brother's room. He's disabled but still gave me a smile.While I was getting dressed Mum fed James.He had Ready Brek.Mum mixed his Tegretol.He needs this because he might have a fit.Mum dressed James.She put on his shoes and coat.While Mum put her shoes on I held James. We started the journey to school.When we got there James started to cry because he knew it would be a long time before he would see us again after school.Mum went home to start patterning. Patterning is to stimulate James' brain and these exercises get his arms and legs moving.The most important exercise is the cross pattern.{Ninety people}help and they all come from Wythall.We have been patterning since James was one. Now he is five. {By MEADOW GREEN.
